name: RoofType
title: Roof Type
description: Roof material types for property insurance underwriting.

concept.definition: Roofing composed of overlapping shingles made from asphalt-saturated fiberglass or organic mat, coated with mineral granules.
Roofing system made of metal panels or tiles, including standing seam, corrugated, or metal shingle configurations.
Roofing tiles made from ceramic or porcelain materials, typically interlocking and providing durable weather protection.
Roofing constructed from natural slate stone quarried and cut into overlapping tiles.
Roofing made from split wood sections (shakes) or sawn wood pieces (shingles), typically cedar or redwood.
Low-slope or flat roof system using synthetic rubber or thermoplastic membranes such as TPO, EPDM, or PVC.
Roofing system using poured concrete or precast concrete panels as the primary structural and weather-resistant surface.
Traditional roofing tiles made from fired clay, often barrel or S-shaped, providing long-lasting weather protection.
Roofing materials manufactured from synthetic polymers designed to mimic traditional roofing materials while offering enhanced durability.
Multi-layer roofing system consisting of alternating layers of bitumen and reinforcing fabrics, typically topped with gravel or a cap sheet.
Roof system partially or completely covered with vegetation and growing medium, planted over a waterproofing membrane.
Roofing material consisting of mineral-surfaced rolls applied in overlapping layers, typically used on low-slope applications.
